etomica.util

Interface History

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HistoryCollapsing, HistoryCollapsingAverage, HistoryCollapsingDiscard, HistoryComplete, HistoryScrolling

    public interface History
    Interface for an object that keeps track of x and y values and return their history when asked. Behavior when the history has more data than the set length length is determined by the subclasses.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addValue(double x, double y)
      Adds the given x, y pair to the History.
      double[] getHistory()
      Returns an array containing the y values that have been added to the History.
      int getHistoryLength()
      Returns the number of data points tracked by the History.
      int getSampleCount()
      Returns the number of data samples currently held by the History.
      double[] getXValues()
      Returns an array containing the x values that have been added to the History.
      void reset()
      Resets the History.
      void setHistoryLength(int n)
      Sets the number of data points to be tracked by the History.

    • Method Detail

      • setHistoryLength

        void setHistoryLength(int n)
        Sets the number of data points to be tracked by the History.

      • getHistoryLength

        int getHistoryLength()
        Returns the number of data points tracked by the History.

      • getSampleCount

        int getSampleCount()
        Returns the number of data samples currently held by the History.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the History. Memory of all data given via addValue is dropped.

      • addValue

        boolean addValue(double x,
                 double y)
        Adds the given x, y pair to the History. Returns true if getHistory will now return different values.

      • getXValues

        double[] getXValues()
        Returns an array containing the x values that have been added to the History.

      • getHistory

        double[] getHistory()
        Returns an array containing the y values that have been added to the History.
